Package it.uniroma1.mdp.model.players

Class Player

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
it.uniroma1.mdp.model.players.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComputerPlayer, HumanPlayer
public abstract class Player extends Observable implements Cloneable
Abstract class representing a player in a card game. Inherits from Observable for potential notifications. Implements Cloneable for creating deep copies of player instances.

      public boolean equals(Object o)

    • clone

      public Player clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException
      Creates a deep copy of the Player object. Clones both the array of cards and each card within it.
      Throws:
      CloneNotSupportedException

    • isPlayerHandSet

      public boolean isPlayerHandSet()
      This method check if all position in the array of cards are set with a Card.

    • getNickname

      public String getNickname()
      Returns the 'nickname' property of the Player.

    • getHand

      public Card[] getHand()
      Returns the array of Card of this Player.

    • getCardAt

      public Card getCardAt(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Get the card from the 'hand' property of the Player, at the specified index. If the index is not valid, it throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException. Returns the Card.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • getHandSize

      public int getHandSize()
      Get the size of the cards in the hand of the Player.
      Returns:

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname(String nickname)
      Sets the nickname of the player.

    • setCardAt

      public void setCardAt(int index, Card card) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Sets the card at the specified index in the player's hand. Throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is not valid.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • setHand

      public void setHand(Card[] hand)
      Sets the entire hand of the player. If the provided hand is not null, updates the player's hand with it.
